wwm
LIVERIGHT PUBLISHING CORPORATION
386 PARK AYE. SOUTH, NEW YORK 16, N. Y.
CABLE: LIVERIGHT, NEW YORK
March 16th, 1964
James A. Fellows, Ass't Dir.
National Assoc, of Educational Broadcasters
Office of Research & Development
1346 Connecticut Ave.
Washington 36, D.C.
Dear Mr. Fellows:
In response to your letter of March 12th, you have our permission to
use the poem by Hart Crane, MNorth Labrador” or "Voyages I" from:
THE COLLECTED POEMS OF HART CRANE
for broadcasting in connection with The Voice of America to develop an
English Through Poetry series, in which Prof. Rosenthal of New York University
would produce thirteen quarter-hour radio scripts on the basis of these
commentaries.
There will be no ©harge for this permission. Regarding publication
of these poems in any given country, there will be no fee, provided the books
are distributed free to radio listeners by the U.S.I.A. If there is a charge
made then we would have to make a nominal charge of $10.00 per poem for each
publication.
Enclosed is our catalog of publications.
Yours faithfully.
Arthur Pell
AP:nsf
Enc.
